
Thanks for reporting, @eximius313.

Do you mind creating a project that reproduces the problem? I think it is worth checking which how Hibernate dependencies are changing when updating to M3.

Best.

Ok, so I reproduced problem with Metamodel Generator: [play-annotation-processor-bug.zip](https://github.com/playframework/playframework/files/2372474/play-annotation-processor-bug.zip)
In my project I also observe problems with Lombok, but I couldn't reproduce that here. 
Nevertheless, I think they are related, so if you fix this bug, I'll check if Lombok works fine
I ran it, and verified it indeed works with 2.6 and fails with 2.7. How bizarre!

I think, that this is good to note in Migration Guide.
And indeed, with [this version](https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.hibernate/hibernate-jpamodelgen/5.3.6.Final) everything compiles just fine
Reopening so that we can close after adding the details to our migration guide.

issue.title: Add note about Hibernate Validator compatibility

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

issue.body:
## Fixes

Fixes #8603.

## Purpose

Explains that Hibernate Validator update can cause some compatibility issues with other Hibernate dependencies.

## References

https://github.com/playframework/playframework/issues/8603#issuecomment-421495463

body:
@marcospereira I have exactly the same problem now with newest Mapstruct (1.3.0.Beta2).
* Play 2.6 + 1.2.0.Final = work fine
* Play 2.6 + Mapstruct 1.3.0.Beta2 = work fine
* Play 2.7.0 + 1.2.0.Final = work fine
* Play 2.7.0 + Mapstruct 1.3.0.Beta2 = error:
```
[error] C:\workspaces\project\repository\CompanyRepository.java:11:1: cannot find symbol
[error]   symbol:   class Company_
[error]   location: package domain
[error] import domain.Company_;
[error] C:\workspaces\project\repository\CompanyRepository.java:12:1: cannot find symbol
[error]   symbol:   class User_
[error]   location: package domain
[error] import domain.User_;
```
